verses.kjv: Afterward he brought me again unto the door of the house; and, behold, waters issued out from under the threshold of the house eastward: for the forefront of the house stood toward the east, and the waters came down from under from the right side of the house, at the south side of the altar.
verses.ct: Then he brought me back to the entrance of the temple, and I saw water flowing out from under the threshold of the temple toward the east, since the temple faced east. The water flowed down from the right side of the temple, south of the altar.

verses.kjv: Then brought he me out of the way of the gate northward, and led me about the way without unto the utter gate by the way that looketh eastward; and, behold, there ran out waters on the right side.
verses.ct: He led me out through the north gate and around the outside to the outer gate that faces east, and there was water trickling out from the right side.

verses.kjv: And when the man that had the line in his hand went forth eastward, he measured a thousand cubits, and he brought me through the waters; the waters were to the ankles.
verses.ct: The man with the measuring line in his hand walked eastward and measured off about 1,500 feet, then led me through the water. It was ankle-deep.

verses.kjv: Again he measured a thousand, and brought me through the waters; the waters were to the knees. Again he measured a thousand, and brought me through; the waters were to the loins.
verses.ct: He measured off another 1,500 feet and led me through the water again — this time it was knee-deep. He measured another 1,500 feet and brought me through, and the water reached my waist.

verses.kjv: Afterward he measured a thousand; and it was a river that I could not pass over: for the waters were risen, waters to swim in, a river that could not be passed over.
verses.ct: Then he measured another 1,500 feet, and now it had become a river I couldn't cross on foot. The water had risen deep enough to swim in — a river too deep to wade through.

verses.kjv: And he said unto me, Son of man, hast thou seen this? Then he brought me, and caused me to return to the brink of the river.
verses.ct: He asked me, "Son of man, did you take all of this in?" Then he brought me back to the bank of the river.

verses.kjv: Now when I had returned, behold, at the bank of the river were very many trees on the one side and on the other.
verses.ct: When I got back, I noticed a huge number of trees growing on both sides of the riverbank.

verses.kjv: Then said he unto me, These waters issue out toward the east country, and go down into the desert, and go into the sea: which being brought forth into the sea, the waters shall be healed.
verses.ct: He told me, "This water flows toward the eastern region, goes down into the Arabah valley, and empties into the Dead Sea. When it reaches that sea, the stagnant water there will become fresh."

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that every thing that liveth, which moveth, whithersoever the rivers shall come, shall live: and there shall be a very great multitude of fish, because these waters shall come thither: for they shall be healed; and every thing shall live whither the river cometh.
verses.ct: "Every living creature that swarms will thrive wherever this river flows. There will be an enormous number of fish, because this water makes everything fresh. Life will flourish everywhere the river goes."

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that the fishers shall stand upon it from Engedi even unto Eneglaim; they shall be a place to spread forth nets; their fish shall be according to their kinds, as the fish of the great sea, exceeding many.
verses.ct: "Fishermen will stand along its shores from En Gedi all the way to En Eglaim. It will become a place for spreading nets. The fish will be of every kind, as plentiful as the fish in the Mediterranean Sea."

verses.kjv: But the miry places thereof and the marishes thereof shall not be healed; they shall be given to salt.
verses.ct: "However, the swamps and marshes will not become fresh — they will be left for producing salt."

verses.kjv: And by the river upon the bank thereof, on this side and on that side, shall grow all trees for meat, whose leaf shall not fade, neither shall the fruit thereof be consumed: it shall bring forth new fruit according to his months, because their waters they issued out of the sanctuary: and the fruit thereof shall be for meat, and the leaf thereof for medicine.
verses.ct: "Along both banks of the river, every kind of fruit tree will grow. Their leaves will never wither, and they will never stop producing fruit. They will bear fresh fruit every month, because their water flows from the sanctuary. Their fruit will be for food, and their leaves will be for healing."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the Lord GOD; This shall be the border, whereby ye shall inherit the land according to the twelve tribes of Israel: Joseph shall have two portions.
verses.ct: This is what the Lord GOD says: "These are the boundaries by which you will distribute the land among the 12 tribes of Israel. Joseph will receive 2 portions."

verses.kjv: And ye shall inherit it, one as well as another: concerning the which I lifted up mine hand to give it unto your fathers: and this land shall fall unto you for inheritance.
verses.ct: "You will each inherit an equal share. I swore an oath to give this land to your ancestors, and now it falls to you as your inheritance."

verses.kjv: And this shall be the border of the land toward the north side, from the great sea, the way of Hethlon, as men go to Zedad;
verses.ct: "This will be the northern boundary of the land: from the Mediterranean Sea along the road to Hethlon, continuing toward Zedad,"

verses.kjv: Hamath, Berothah, Sibraim, which is between the border of Damascus and the border of Hamath; Hazarhatticon, which is by the coast of Hauran.
verses.ct: "then to Hamath, Berothah, and Sibraim (which is between the territory of Damascus and the territory of Hamath), and on to Hazer Hatticon, which is on the border of Hauran."

verses.kjv: And the border from the sea shall be Hazarenan, the border of Damascus, and the north northward, and the border of Hamath. And this is the north side.
verses.ct: "So the boundary will extend from the sea to Hazar Enan, along the border of Damascus, with the border of Hamath to the north. That is the northern boundary."

verses.kjv: And the east side ye shall measure from Hauran, and from Damascus, and from Gilead, and from the land of Israel by Jordan, from the border unto the east sea. And this is the east side.
verses.ct: "On the eastern side, the boundary will run between Hauran and Damascus, along the Jordan between Gilead and the land of Israel, down to the eastern sea. That is the eastern boundary."

verses.kjv: And the south side southward, from Tamar even to the waters of strife in Kadesh, the river to the great sea. And this is the south side southward.
verses.ct: "On the southern side, the boundary will go from Tamar to the waters of Meribah Kadesh, then along the Wadi of Egypt to the Mediterranean Sea. That is the southern boundary."

verses.kjv: The west side also shall be the great sea from the border, till a man come over against Hamath. This is the west side.
verses.ct: "On the western side, the Mediterranean Sea will serve as the boundary up to a point opposite Hamath. That is the western boundary."

verses.kjv: So shall ye divide this land unto you according to the tribes of Israel.
verses.ct: "You are to divide this land among yourselves according to the tribes of Israel."

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that ye shall divide it by lot for an inheritance unto you, and to the strangers that sojourn among you, which shall beget children among you: and they shall be unto you as born in the country among the children of Israel; they shall have inheritance with you among the tribes of Israel.
verses.ct: "You are to distribute it by lot as an inheritance for yourselves and also for the foreigners living among you who have children in your land. You must treat them as native-born Israelites. They will receive an inheritance along with you among the tribes of Israel."

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that in what tribe the stranger sojourneth, there shall ye give him his inheritance, saith the Lord GOD.
verses.ct: "In whatever tribe a foreigner resides, that is where you must give him his inheritance," declares the Lord GOD.
